info.title: AuthorizationManagementClient
info.description: Attribute namespaces provide a way to organize attributes associated with Federated Managed Identities. These attributes can also be used in attribute-based access control conditions in Azure role assignments. These operations enable users to manage attribute namespaces at the provider level to guarantee tenant-level uniqueness.

parameters.name: attributeNamespace
parameters.description: The name of the attribute namespace to create.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for creating the attribute namespace.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the updated attribute namespace.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: attributeNamespace
parameters.description: The name of the attribute namespace to get.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the attribute namespace.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: attributeNamespace
parameters.description: The name of the attribute namespace to delete.

200.description: OK - The attribute namespace was successfully deleted.

204.description: No Content - The attribute namespace does not exist or was already deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

AttributeNamespaceCreateRequest.description: Request body for creating an attribute namespace.

namespaceOwnerPrincipalId.description: The principal ID of the namespace owner.

id.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the attribute namespace. For example, /providers/Microsoft.Authorization/attributeNamespaces/{attributeNamespace}.

name.description: The name of the attribute namespace.

type.description: The type of the resource. For example, Microsoft.Authorization/attributeNamespaces.

CloudError.description: An error response from the service.

CloudErrorBody.description: An error response from the service.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.
